subject: Marathon Running
lead_paragraph: Haile Gebrselassie is aiming to break his own marathon world record — and earn a hefty payday — at the Dubai Marathon on Friday. Gebrselassie, a 35-year-old Ethiopian, will earn a $1 million bonus — on top of the $250,000 winner’s prize — if he improves on the record of 2 hours 3 minutes 59 seconds he set in Berlin in September. That would also mean setting his 27th world record over all.
